page.title: 15FRISKNEY FEAST DAY
page.content: The Chapel Sunday School anniversary is celebrated in June. It is called Feast Day or Wagon Day and is held on the second Monday of the month. The days events were originally just for the Sunday School children but it bcame so popular that now all the village children can take part and the village primary school is officially closed for the day.There must be very few schools in Lincolnshire nowadays which have a holiday based on an old custom such as this. The children are conveyed around the village in decorated drays pulled by carthorses which themselves are decorated for the occasion. Such wagons and horses are rare these days. Afterwards the children have tea followed by games.
